text.textblock: (iii) The agency must agree, if a waiver is granted, to notify HCFA of any event that occurs that changes the conditions upon which the waiver was approved.

(2) HCFA will review a State's request to have a requirement specified under paragraph (e)(1) of this section waived and will request additional information from the State, if necessary. HCFA will notify the State of its approval or disapproval determination within 30 days of receipt of a properly documented request.

(3) HCFA may rescind the waiver at any time that it determines that the State no longer meets the criteria for approving the waiver. If the waiver is rescinded, the agency has 6 months from the date of the rescission notice to meet the requirement that had been waived.

(4) An agency requesting a waiver of the requirements specifically concerning either 60-day limit in paragraph (d)(1) or (d)(2) of this section must submit documentation of written agreement between the agency and third party, including Medicare fiscal intermediaries and carriers, that extension of the billing requirement is agreeable to all parties.
(Catalog of Federal Domestic Assistance Program No. 93.778- Medical Assistance Program)
